label: Leak ionic current
definition: General leaking ionic current, including different potential ionic sources (i.e., Na channels, k channels, ...).

label: Sodium leak current
definition: Sodium leaking ionic current.

label: Sodium transient fast current
definition: Fast, transient, inactivating sodium current [NeuronDB: I Na,t].

label: Sodium transient slow current
definition: Slow, transient, inactivating sodium current.

label: Sodium pesistent current
definition: Persistent (or noninactivating) sodium current [NeuronDB: I Na,p].

label: Potassium delayed rectifier
definition: Delayed rectifier, slowly inactivating or non-inactivating [NeuronDB: I K].

label: Potassium leak current
definition: Potassium leaking ionic current [NeuronDB: I K,leak].

label: M-type potassium current
definition: Muscarinic receptor-suppressed potassium current [NeuronDB: I M]

label: Fast voltage- and calcium-dependent potassium current
definition: Fast voltage- and [Ca2+]-dependent potassium current [subclass of NeuronDB I K,Ca].

label: Slow calcium-dependent AHP potassium current
definition: Slow [Ca2+]-dependent, afterhyperpolarization potassium current [subclass of NeuronDB I K,Ca].

label: Low threshold calcium T-current
definition: Low-threshold inactivating, transient calcium current [NeuronDB: I T low threshold].

label: Slow high threshold calcium current
definition: High-threshold slow or non-inactivating calcium current [NeuronDB: I L high threshold].

label: q- and p-type calcium current
definition: Includes both p-type and q-type calcium currents [NeuronDB: I p,q].

label: N-type calcium current
definition: Rapidly inactivating calcium current with threshold around -20 mV. Underlies Ca2+ spikes that are prominent in dendrites. Involved in synaptic transmission [NeuronDB: I N].

label: Calcium activated chloride current
definition: Calcium activated chloride current. Can enhance or decrease response depending on the Cl- equilibrium potential [NeuronDB: I Cl,Ca].

label: Calcium activated nonspecific cation current
definition: Calcium Activated Nonspecific cation current [NeuronDB: I CAN].

label: Cyclic-nucleotide gated nonspecific cation current
definition: Cyclic-Nucleotide Gated nonspecific cation channel [NeuronDB: I CNG].

label: Inward rectifier (h-type) current
definition: Inward rectifier ('Queer'), activated by hyperpolarization, cyclic-nucleotide gated mixed cation current. Prevents strong hyperpolarization; increases membrane resistance during membrane depolarization [NeuronDB: I h]. See (Luthi and McCormick, 1998, Neuron, pp.9-12)

label: Potassium inward rectifier (Kir) current
definition: Potassium inward rectifier activated by hyperpolarization. [included in I h in NeuronDB]. See (Lee and Ishida, 2007, J Neurophysiol, pp.3790-9)

label: Fast voltage-gated potassium (Kf) current
definition: Fast voltage-gated potassium current. See (Kang, Huguenard and Prince, 2000, J Neurophysiol, pp.70-80)

label: Brain region role
definition: Role assigned to particular brain regions according to some criteria that distinguishes among different territories, e.g., association cortex, thalamic relay nucleus

label: Thalamic relay nucleus
definition: A thalamic nucleus that receives a well-defined subcortical input as part of one or the sensory or motor pathways whose cells project to the middle layers of a restricted region of cerebral cortex and receive a reciprocal projection from the same region of cortex. This designation is based on an organizational scheme proposed by Jones (1985), although it is recognized to be an oversimplification of thalamic organization. (adapted from Paxinos, The Rat Nervous System, 2nd ed, Academic Press, 1995.

label: Higher order thalamic relay nucleus
definition: A thalamic relay nucleus that relays information from layer 5 of one cortical area to another, as distinguished from a first order relay nucleus that transmits subcortical information to the cortex, as proposed by Sherman and Guillery. All thalamic relays receive a layer-6 modulatory input from cortex, but higher-order relays in addition receive a layer-5 driver input, e.g., pulvinar nucleus.

label: First order thalamic relay nucleus
definition: Thalamic relay nucleus that relays subcortical information to the cortex for the first time, as proposed by Sherman and Guillery, e.g., lateral geniculate nucleus. First order relay nuclei are distinguished from higher order relay nuclei, e.g., the pulvinar, which relay information from the cortex itself.
